Back.name: Pull-Ups
Instructions: Grip the bar with your hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away from you.
Hang freely with your arms fully extended.
Pull yourself up by bending your elbows and raising your body until your chin passes the bar.
Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.

Back.name: Bent-Over Barbell Rows
Instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Bend your knees slightly and hinge forward at the hips, keeping your back flat and chest up.
Pull the barbell towards your lower chest by retracting your shoulder blades and bending your elbows.
Lower the barbell back down to the starting position.

Back.name: Seated Cable Rows
Back.Equipment: Cable machine with seated row attachment
Instructions: Sit at the cable machine with your knees slightly bent and feet flat on the footrests.
Grasp the handles with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep your back straight and chest up as you pull the handles towards your lower chest by retracting your shoulder blades.
Slowly return to the starting position with control.

Back.name: Deadlifts
Instructions: Stand with your feet hip-width apart and shins close to the barbell.
Bend at your hips and knees to grip the barbell with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep your back flat, chest up, and core engaged as you stand up, lifting the barbell by extending your hips and knees.
Lower the barbell back down to the starting position with control.

Back.name: Lat Pulldowns
Instructions: Sit at the lat pulldown machine with your knees secured under the pads and feet flat on the floor.
Grasp the bar with an overhand grip, hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
Pull the bar down towards your chest by engaging your lats and retracting your shoulder blades.
Slowly release the bar back up to the starting position.

Back.name: Dumbbell Rows
Instructions: Place one knee and hand on a bench, with the other foot planted firmly on the floor.
Hold a dumbbell in the opposite hand with an overhand grip.
Keep your back flat and parallel to the ground as you pull the dumbbell towards your hip by retracting your shoulder blade and bending your elbow.
Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.

Back.name: Hyperextensions
Instructions: Lie face down on the hyperextension bench with your hips positioned at the edge and your feet secured under the pads.
Cross your arms over your chest or hold a weight plate to your chest.
Engage your lower back muscles to lift your torso until it is parallel to the ground.
Lower your torso back down to the starting position.

Back.name: T-Bar Rows
Back.Equipment: T-bar row machine or landmine attachment, barbell
Instructions: Place the end of a barbell into the landmine attachment or T-bar row machine.
Straddle the barbell with your feet shoulder-width apart and grip the handles with both hands.
Keep your back flat and chest up as you hinge forward at the hips.
Pull the barbell towards your lower chest by retracting your shoulder blades.
Lower the barbell back down to the starting position.

Back.name: Single-Arm Dumbbell Rows
Instructions: Place one knee and hand on a bench, with the other foot planted firmly on the floor.
Hold a dumbbell in one hand with an overhand grip.
Keep your back flat and parallel to the ground as you pull the dumbbell towards your hip by retracting your shoulder blade and bending your elbow.
Lower the dumbbell back down to the starting position.

Back.name: Barbell Shrugs
Instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and hold a barbell with an overhand grip, hands slightly wider than shoulder-width.
Keep your arms straight and shrug your shoulders upward towards your ears, lifting the barbell as high as possible.
Hold for a moment at the top of the movement, then lower the barbell back down to the starting position.

Back.name: Inverted Rows
Instructions: Adjust the suspension trainer straps to chest height or use a low bar.
Grasp the handles with an overhand grip and walk your feet forward, leaning back until your body is at an angle.
Keep your body straight from head to heels as you pull your chest towards the handles by retracting your shoulder blades.
Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.

Back.name: Renegade Rows
Instructions: Start in a high plank position with a dumbbell in each hand, wrists aligned with shoulders.
Keeping your core engaged and hips level, row one dumbbell towards your hip while stabilizing with the other arm.
Lower the dumbbell back down to the ground and repeat on the other side.

Back.name: Straight-Arm Pulldowns
Back.Equipment: Lat pulldown machine, straight bar attachment
Instructions: Sit at the lat pulldown machine with your knees secured under the pads and feet flat on the floor.
Grasp the straight bar with an overhand grip, hands wider than shoulder-width apart.
Keep your arms straight and pull the bar down towards your thighs by engaging your lats.
Slowly release the bar back up to the starting position.

Back.name: Face Pulls
Instructions: Attach a rope to a high pulley on the cable machine.
Grasp the ends of the rope with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Step back and lean back slightly, keeping your arms extended.
Pull the rope towards your face by squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Pause, then slowly return to the starting position.

Back.name: Wide-Grip Pull-Ups
Instructions: Grip the bar with hands wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away from you.
Hang from the bar with arms fully extended.
Pull yourself up until your chin clears the bar, keeping your chest up and shoulders back.
Lower yourself back down to the starting position with control.

Back.name: Seated Cable Rows
Instructions: Sit at the cable machine with your knees slightly bent and feet flat on the platform.
Grasp the V-bar attachment with an overhand grip, hands shoulder-width apart.
Keep your back straight and pull the handle towards your torso by retracting your shoulder blades.
Pause, then slowly extend your arms back to the starting position.

Back.name: Hyperextensions
Instructions: Adjust the hyperextension bench so that your hips are resting at the top pad and your ankles are secured under the rollers.
Cross your arms over your chest or hold a weight plate to your chest.
Keeping your back straight, lower your torso towards the ground until your body forms a straight line.
Lift your torso back up until it is parallel to the ground.

Back.name: Dumbbell Deadlifts
Instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding dumbbells in front of thighs with palms facing your body.
Hinge at your hips and bend your knees slightly as you lower the dumbbells towards the ground.
Keep your back flat and chest up.
Push through your heels to return to standing, squeezing your glutes at the top.

Back.name: Pull-Up Negatives
Instructions: Jump or use a chair to get your chin above the bar.
Slowly lower yourself down, taking at least 3-5 seconds to descend.
Focus on controlling the movement and engaging your back muscles.
Once you reach the bottom, reset and repeat.

Back.name: Prone Cobras
Instructions: Lie face down on the mat with arms by your sides and palms facing up.
Lift your chest and arms off the ground, squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Hold for a moment, then lower back down.
Focus on engaging your back muscles throughout the movement.

Back.name: T-Bar Rows
Back.Equipment: T-bar row machine or landmine attachment, barbell
Instructions: Load the appropriate weight onto the T-bar machine or secure a barbell in a landmine attachment.
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, knees slightly bent, and hinge at the hips to grab the handles or barbell with an overhand grip.
Keep your back straight and chest up as you pull the weight towards your lower chest, retracting your shoulder blades.
Slowly lower the weight back down to the starting position.

Back.name: Pullovers
Instructions: Lie on a bench with only your upper back and shoulders supported, feet flat on the floor.
Hold a dumbbell or barbell with both hands above your chest, arms slightly bent.
Lower the weight behind your head in a controlled motion, feeling a stretch in your lats.
Pull the weight back up to the starting position, engaging your lats.

Back.name: Good Mornings
Instructions: Stand with your feet shoulder-width apart and a barbell across your upper back, resting on your traps.
Keep your back straight and core engaged as you hinge at your hips, leaning forward until your torso is parallel to the ground.
Keep a slight bend in your knees throughout the movement.
Return to the starting position by squeezing your glutes and extending your hips.

Back.name: Back Extensions
Back.Equipment: Back extension machine or hyperextension bench
Instructions: Position yourself face down on the back extension machine or hyperextension bench, with your hips resting on the pad and your feet secured under the footpads.
Cross your arms over your chest or place your hands behind your head.
Keeping your back straight, slowly lift your torso until it is in line with your legs.
Lower yourself back down with control.
